required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of Prognostic Factors in Patients Admitted to ICU for Stroke
clinical_study.official_title: Study of Prognostic Factors in Patients Admitted to ICU for Stroke

brief_summary.textblock:
Outcome of stroke patients admitted to the intensive care unit the intensive care unit (ICU) is poor and haemorrhagic stroke, fixed dilated pupil(s) and GCS <10 are associated with increased mortality and poor functional outcome. However little is known about the impact of clinical events occuring during the ICU stay (ventilator acquired pneumoniae, shock, dysglycemia....).
The objective of this study was to determine the mortality rate and the functional outcomes of stroke patients admitted to ICU and to identify predictors of poor outcome in this population.

primary_outcome.time_frame: through ICU hospitalization, an average of one month

secondary_outcome.time_frame: at hospitalization discharge, an average of three months
secondary_outcome.description: Modified Rankin Score (0: no symptoms at all; 6: dead)

study_pop.textblock: All patients with acute stroke admitted to ICU in the Brest Teaching Hospital (Cavale Blanche) BREST (The Brest REgistry of STroke)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- acute stroke
- ICU admission for acute stroke
- 1 organ dysfunction : coma, shock, respiratory failure
Exclusion Criteria:
- refuse participation

patient_data.ipd_description: All collected data that underlie results in a publication
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: Data will be available beginning two year and ending five years following the end study
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: Data access requests will be reviewed by the internal committee of Brest UH. Requestors will be required to sign and complete a data access agreement.
